page.title: 10Other buildings in Mark
page.content: There are 2{Halls}in Mark now. The older one is the{Church Hall}used as a Sunday School and for Jumble Sales etc. It is in Vicarage Lane. The newer building is the{Village Hall}in Vole Road opened on December 15th 1984. This can be used for Dinners, Dances, Receptions, Discos and so on. It can be used for sport and keep fit as well. As well as the Church, there is a {Baptist Chapel}in Church Street,built in 1866,stone built and Gothic. There are 2{Inns}in Mark,quite close to each other,the Pack Horse and the White Horse both frequented equally by the locals and both equally old. At the West End is the only{School}in the area with a present role of 56 pupils and 2 teaching staff.at 9 years old the children transfer to Hugh Sexey's,then to Kings of Wessex at 13.
